mn22:60.1: Thus the teaching has been well explained by me, made clear, opened, illuminated, and stripped of patchwork.
mn22:60.2: In this teaching there are mendicants who are perfected, who have ended the defilements, lived the spiritual life, done what had to be done, laid down the burden, achieved their purpose, utterly ended the fetters of rebirth, and are rightly freed through final knowledge. For them, there is no cycle of rebirths to be found. …
mn22:61.2: In this teaching there are mendicants who have given up the five lower fetters. All of them are reborn spontaneously. They are extinguished there, and are not liable to return from that world. …
mn22:62.2: In this teaching there are mendicants who, having given up three fetters, and weakened greed, hate, and delusion, are once-returners. All of them come back to this world once only, then make an end of suffering. …
mn22:63.2: In this teaching there are mendicants who have ended three fetters. All of them are stream-enterers, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, bound for awakening. …
mn22:64.2: In this teaching there are mendicants who are followers of principles, followers by faith. All of them are bound for awakening.
mn22:65.1: Thus the teaching has been well explained by me, made clear, opened, illuminated, and stripped of patchwork.
mn22:65.2: In this teaching there are those who have a degree of faith and love for me. All of them are bound for heaven.”
